isis.stitle: BP-R1 BOBTAIL BRAKE PROPORTIONING RELAY VALVE AND LQ-5 BOBTAIL LIMITING VALVE - MAINTENANCE - LQ-5 INSPECTION TEST

svcproc.title: LQ-5 INSPECTION TEST

step1.para: Charge the air brake system to a minimum of 100 psi air pressure.
Release the tractor park brake by pushing in the yellow, diamond shaped park brake knob.
Activate the trailer brake control system by depressing the red (octagonal- shaped) control knob.
Apply the brakes by partially depressing the brake pedal (treadle) and hold the pedal in this partially depressed position.
The observer should note the movement (stroke) of the front slack adjusters and the position of the yoke-pin in the slack adjuster.
With the brake pedal in the partially depressed position, pull the red (octagonal-shaped) trailer brake control knob out to deactivate the trailer brake control system.
The observer should observe a further movement (increased stroke) of the front axle slack adjusters and yoke-pin.

svcproc.para: The front axle slack adjusters and yoke-pins should move away from the chambers as a result of the partial brake application in step 4 and then move further away from the chamber (longer stroke) after the trailer brake control is released (deactivated) in step 6. These two reactions confirm that the front axle brakes operate at full pressure with the tractor in the "bobtail mode" and at reduced pressure when the tractor is coupled to a trailer.
If the performance of the LQ-5 is not as described, perform the OPERATION, and LEAKAGE TEST, described in SERVICE CHECKS.
